title: Republicans Battle for Runner-Up as Trump Leads Iowa Caucuses
description: Donald Trump’s three closest rivals for the Republican presidential nomination each see a strong chance of finishing second in the Iowa caucuses as the race for runner-up comes to a head, according to people familiar with the campaigns.

title: Iowa Republicans Rank Immigration as Top Issue Ahead of Economy
description: About a quarter of Iowa Republican voters ranked immigration as the most important issue facing the US while a third picked the economy as their top concern, according to AP VoteCast.

title: Sunak Adviser Urges Tories to Stop Plotting Before Rwanda Vote
description: Rishi Sunak’s top political strategist warned Conservative MPs that divisions would mean certain defeat in this year’s UK general election, as party rebels threatened to derail the prime minister’s flagship migration bill unless he makes it tougher.

title: Three Keys to Interpreting Tonight’s Iowa Caucus Results
description: In this Washington Edition special, Bloomberg Businessweek columnist Joshua Green outlines what to watch for in tonight’s balloting in Iowa. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Venezuela Boosts Minimum Wage by 43% to Quell Growing Protests
description: Venezuela raised its monthly minimum wage by the equivalent of more than 40% as protests by disgruntled public workers grow ahead of presidential elections this year.

title: DeSantis Has Enough Cash to Sustain 2024 Bid Into March, Adviser Says
description: Ron DeSantis has enough cash to sustain his 2024 US presidential bid past Monday’s Iowa Republican caucus into crucial primaries in March, one of his finance chairs said, reassuring donors concerned about his standing in polls.

title: Italy’s ESM Refusal Deprives EU of Powerful Tool, Officials Say
description: The Italian parliament’s rejection of a European Union bailout fund late last year leaves the bloc without a powerful tool to protect taxpayers from a future banking crisis, EU officials said.

title: Ukraine, Switzerland Prepare Meeting to Push Peace Formula
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said his government is working with Switzerland to hold a high-level peace conference in the Alpine nation as Kyiv seeks to recruit allies for a peace blueprint.

title: US Defense Chief Leaves Hospital After Stay That Caused Uproar
description: US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin was released from the hospital after a two-week stay to treat complications from prostate-cancer surgery, an episode that prompted calls for his resignation over his failure to tell the White House about his condition for several days.

title: Iowa’s Ernst Urges Action ‘Right Now’ on Senate Border Proposal
description: US lawmakers are on the cusp of an “incredible opportunity” to give the next president tools to better control migration at the US-Mexico border, Republican Senator Joni Ernst of Iowa said.

title: Ahead of Davos, China Says Swiss Can Come Visit Without Visas
description: Switzerland will join a handful of European countries that China is granting visa-free access to visit.

title: Iowa Latest: Senator Joni Ernst Gravitates to Haley’s Positions
description: Record cold temperatures across Iowa is adding more uncertainty ahead of Monday’s caucuses, the first contest for the 2024 Republican presidential nomination. All the contenders have urged their backers to brave the weather and register their support. Iowa Republican officials say they are confident their voters will turn out.

title: Israel’s Original Tech Entrepreneur Wants an End to Hamas War
description: Yossi Vardi, an investor who helped pioneer Israel’s tech economy in the 1990s, wants the war with Hamas to end, taking an unusual stance on a conflict that remains broadly popular domestically.

title: Milei to Meet Georgieva in Davos After Winning Key IMF Support
description: Javier Milei, Argentina's president, delivers a speech from the balcony of the Casa Rosada in Buenos Aires, Argentina, on Sunday, Dec. 10, 2023. Milei took office as Argentina's president Sunday, promising to eradicate inflation and rescue the nation's troubled economy with a shock-therapy program based on drastic cuts to public spending. Photographer: Sarah Pabst/Bloomberg

title: US Vessel Hit by Missile as Shippers Told to Avoid Red Sea
description: Houthi militants hit a US-owned commercial vessel with an anti-ship ballistic missile on Monday, underscoring warnings that the world’s most important trade artery remains too risky for navigation.

title: EU  Watches for Red Sea Attacks’ Economic Impact, Gentiloni Says
description: Tensions in the Red Sea as Houthi militants attack commercial vessels may start to have an impact on energy prices and inflation in the coming weeks, according to the European Union’s economy chief.

title: Eurogroup Head Expects Euro Area to Grow Around 1% This Year
description: The euro-area economy will probably grow around 1% this year as it resists the impact of high inflation and the war in Ukraine, Eurogroup President Paschal Donohoe said.

title: Why Germany Is Rich But Germans Are Poor and Angry
description: Germany’s grossly unequal distribution of wealth is contributing to the country’s malaise.

title: Israel’s Appetite for War Against Hezbollah Grows
description: The war between Israel and Hamas has reached the 100-day mark with few signs that either side is preparing to rein in their campaign, and with the regional fallout from the devastating conflict worsening.

title: What Westminster Should Know About The Coming US Election
description: Get caught up on the day’s political news

title: Philippines Moves Closer to Raising Foreign Holding Limits
description: A proposal to amend the Philippine Constitution to allow greater foreign ownership was filed in the Senate by its top official, further setting in motion efforts to open the Southeast Asian nation to more investors.

title: Sunak Says UK’s Aim Is to ‘De-Escalate Tensions’ in the Red Sea
description: The UK wants to “de-escalate tensions” in the Red Sea and that it joined US-led air strikes on Houthi positions in Yemen as a “last resort,” Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said ahead of his statement to Parliament Monday.

title: Davos Elite Size Up the Global Risks of Another Trump Presidency
description: Donald Trump is thousands of miles away from the Alpine Swiss town of Davos but talk of his possible return to the White House is on everyone’s lips even before the annual shindig of the global elite has kicked off.

title: South Africa’s Godongwana Warns of Difficult Budget Next Month
description: South Africa’s finance minister warned that next month’s budget will be a “difficult one” as the nation’s ability to service its growing debt remains a challenge.

title: Record Cold, Long Lines: What to Watch During the Iowa Caucus
description: Punishing weather conditions inject more uncertainty in the first-in-the-nation nominating contest.

title: China Opts for Isolation of Taiwan After Democratic Vote
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: Poland’s Duda Blocks Prosecutor’s Removal as Tusk Seeks Overhaul
description: Polish President Andrzej Duda rejected the government’s decision to dismiss a top prosecutor, complicating Prime Minister Donald Tusk’s effort to overhaul the judiciary.

title: Imran Khan’s Party Vows to Fight Election Despite Effective Ban
description: Candidates from Imran Khan’s party will contest next month’s national vote in Pakistan as independents, using different election symbols after the country’s top court barred them from their traditional cricket bat image.

title: Biden Campaign Raised $97 Million, Has Record Levels of Cash
description: President Joe Biden’s campaign raised $97 million in the fourth quarter, a massive sum that is likely to dwarf the fundraising of his Republican competitors, including Donald Trump.

title: Turkey Skips Davos Over World Economic Forum’s Hamas War Stance
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan asked his country’s officials to skip this year’s World Economic Forum in Davos over the organizers’ stance on Israel’s war against Hamas, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: The Massive Economic Impact If China Invades Taiwan
description: How economists are thinking about the risks.

title: Israeli Footballer Detained in Turkey For Goal Gesture Over Gaza War
description: An Israeli footballer who was detained in Turkey for a goal celebration referencing Hamas’s Oct. 7 attack on Israel has been released, after the incident sparked a new diplomatic spat between the two countries over their opposing stances on the war in Gaza.

title: Taiwan Election Keeps Status Quo, Changes Everything: Next China
description: Hi, this is Cindy Wang in Taipei with a special edition of the Next China newsletter. You may be receiving this because you subscribe to one of our other newsletters, including  Economics Daily,  Five Things: Asia and Balance of Power. If you’d like to keep reading Next China, sign up here.

title: Israel Will Only End War in Gaza With ‘Total Surrender of Hamas’
description: Israel insists its campaign against Hamas won’t end before the Palestinian militant organization capitulates and returns all the people it took captive over three months ago, a senior official said, despite mounting international pressure to wind down the offensive.

title: Denmark’s New King to Attend Parliament After Enthronement
description: Denmark’s newly proclaimed king, Frederik X, is appearing before lawmakers on Monday as festivities around his enthronement continue.

title: China Convinces Nauru to Cut Ties With Taiwan After Key Election
description: The Pacific island nation of Nauru said it will switch diplomatic ties to Beijing instead of Taipei.

title: Philippines Plans to Develop Outposts in South China Sea
description: The Philippines’ military chief said the nation plans to develop its outposts in the South China Sea, and acquire more ships and radars amid lingering tensions with Beijing in contested waters.

title: Tiny Azerbaijan Has a Mighty Job Ahead for COP29
description: As this year’s United Nations climate summit host, the country could be a strong voice for developing nations despite skepticism about its own intentions.

title: After 100 Days of War, Israel Is Not Backing Down
description: As appetite for taking on Hezbollah increases, the question remains whether the conflict will spread from Gaza and turn into a wider conflagration.

title: Maldives Tells India to Remove Its Troops by Mid-March
description: The president of the Maldives told India it must withdraw its troops from the island by March, making good on an election promise as he draws closer to China.

title: US Shoots Down Cruise Missile Fired from Houthi Area in Yemen
description: US fighter aircraft shot down a cruise missile fired from a Houthi militant area of Yemen toward a Navy destroyer operating in the southern Red Sea, the US military said, adding there were no injuries or damage reported.

title: North Korea Sends Foreign Minister to Russia as Arms Ties Build
description: North Korean Foreign Minister Choe Son Hui left on a trip to Russia that could facilitate a visit by President Vladimir Putin to Pyongyang and enhance arms transfers that have replenished the Kremlin’s arsenal to attack Ukraine.

title: US Congress Unveils Temporary Spending Bill to Avert Shutdown
description: US lawmakers released a stopgap spending bill to avert a partial government shutdown on Jan. 20, greatly reducing the chances of a closure but risking conservative Republican ire against House Speaker Mike Johnson.

title: US Delegation Arrives in Taiwan to Meet Tsai, Other Officials
description: A group of former US officials arrived in Taiwan to meet outgoing President Tsai Ing-wen, talks that will test the recent improvement of ties between Washington and Beijing following a pivotal election on the island.

title: Vietnam Communist Party Chief Makes Appearance After Hospitalization
description: Vietnam Communist Party Chief Nguyen Phu Trong appeared at the National Assembly in Hanoi on Monday after being hospitalized last week due to an unspecified illness.

title: Speaker Johnson Will Reject Senate Border Deal, Jordan Predicts
description: A carefully brokered bipartisan Senate border compromise would be dead-on-arrival in the House — and would draw the opposition of Speaker Mike Johnson, House Judiciary Chairman Jim Jordan said.

title: Rishi Sunak Faces UK Parliament Over Decision to Strike Yemen
description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak will address Parliament on Monday after his government said it’s ready to carry out further strikes on Houthi targets in Yemen if the group continues to attack commercial vessels in the Red Sea.
